User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Ubuntu; X11; Linux i686; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111020171449

Steps to reproduce:

I was asked by test pilot to fill in a survey about "app usage", I was happy to contribute information.


Actual results:

Reading the title and questions I was unable to understand how to answer the questions appropriately.

The survey is focused around "apps" without ever explaining what they means.

I use and download programs on my Android phone - they are called "apps" because that's what Apple calls them. Many (most?) of the core apps are not downloaded from the market at all they are part of the base OS.  Every program you install (regardless of purpose) is named an app.

I use and download programs on my computer - they are called applications or programs because that is what they are. My computer's OS (Ubuntu) provides all programs via an "app store like interface", but its just a shell over normal downloading and installing - My understanding is other OSs are doing the same - MacOS Lion and Windows 8. 

I'm not sure how to understand what the survey is asking questions about.  Is firefox an app?  On Windows it is the first program I download and install when starting fresh.  Does this make it an app that I run on PCs?

Using the mobile phone/tablet idea of an app suggests its not possible for me to answer yes to the 'on my PC' option short of some new emulator problems.


Expected results:

Better framing of the question and maybe a short description of what you are referring to by apps would have been helpful.

I'm sorry if I seem deliberately obtuse - I honestly don't know how to answer the questions in a manner that will provide the information you are trying to collect.

I hope this is an appropriate way to contact you - I found bug 699167 when googling to find any way to feed info back to the survey.  There were no open-ended or useful comment questions to allow this type of question to be added back to the survey.

(and don't get me started on web-based apps,...)
